intro: Erigeron petrophilus var. sierrensis, commonly known as the Sierra fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy ray florets. This plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white or pale blue petals. The Sierra fleabane is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in local pollinator ecosystems.
